Text: dont post false comments on here @polsiehstge11
Bless u, I have been waiting for this for two days and looked everywhere....thank u
no problem mate, its a little hard to get hold of aint it

Hi thanks for ths
I'd love it if you could upload it a little bit sooner!
Thanks.  Unfortunately, the encoding settings you are using are not compatible with Windows Media Center and most, if not all, standalone media players.
Thanks so much for this one and last week's! Any chance you'd release them in 720p also?

Thanks for the upload!  BTW, I don't know why everyone else seems to be having issues with your encoding.  I don't have (and never have had) any playback problems with your uploads.  I use WMP and everything is perfect.
No, it plays fine in WMP.  It's Windows Media Center and standalone players that a lot of us use to playback on televisions that can't play the video. WMP has no trouble.
I got it to work in VLC media player by switching the audio channels to reverse stereo

The scene groups use Autogk to encode their files. Using it will make it compatible with standalone Divx dvd players. You can still use the Xvid codec.

http://www.autogk.me.uk/
Yeah, Autogk will solve all the audio & standalone dvd player issues.

Your audio encoding is a little screwy it's only putting out right channel audio. It's an easy fix in MPC though right click on the video go to audio>options then click "enable custom channel mapping" make sure speaker configuration is set for two input channels then in the grid that un grays itself in the front left and front right boxes make sure the boxes labeled 1 and 2 are checked then hit apply and your done
